building_easy_1.pre: Tap once on all tiles with at least one building or parts of a building.
building_easy_1.post_correct: Great. Swipe left and let's have a look a some more difficult examples.
building_easy_1.post_wrong: ... there are some buildings here. Please map all of them.

building_easy_2.pre: Again tap the tiles that show buildings. Don't be distracted by roads and other features.
building_easy_2.post_correct: Perfect. Swipe left and let's have a look at examples without buildings.
building_easy_2.post_wrong: Oh no. Make sure to map all buildings, also if only small parts of a building are visible in a tile.

maybe_1.pre: Sometimes, you might be unsure whether a feature is a building or not. In those cases tap two times to indicate a maybe. Mark the bottom left tile as maybe.
maybe_1.post_wrong: Even if you are absolutely sure, mark the bottom left tile as maybe to move on with this tutorial.

no_building_easy_1.pre: In many cases there will be no buildings. Just swipe left to map further.
no_building_easy_1.post_wrong: Be careful. We can't find any buildings here.

no_building_easy_2.pre: Also in this example we can't find any building. Swipe left and move on.
no_building_easy_2.post_correct: Isn't it simple? Swipe left and see more examples.
no_building_easy_2.post_wrong: ... even if there are other objects, there are no buildings here.

bad_clouds_1.pre: If you see clouds and no buildings tap three times.
bad_clouds_1.post_wrong: Oh no. Make sure to indicate clouds as well.

bad_no_imagery_1.pre: If imagery is lacking also tap three times.
bad_no_imagery_1.post_wrong: Please mark all tiles for which there is no imagery.

bad_no_imagery_2.pre: You can also swipe down to mark all tiles red at once. (And you can swipe up to redo this.)
bad_no_imagery_2.post_correct: Cool. We're done with the tutorial. Now you are ready for some real mapping projects.
